learningPath.title: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
subtasks: Understand IAM Concepts: Learn about IAM roles, users, groups, and policies.
Create IAM Users: Set up individual IAM users with unique credentials.
Create IAM Groups: Organize IAM users into groups for easier management.
Attach Policies to Users/Groups: Assign permissions using managed and inline policies.
Implement Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA): Enable MFA for IAM users to enhance security.
Review IAM Roles: Understand when to use roles instead of users for temporary access.
Audit IAM Configuration: Use AWS IAM Access Analyzer to review permissions and roles.
learningPath.project: Create an IAM user and policy using Terraform.

learningPath.title: Simple Storage Service (S3)
subtasks: Create S3 Buckets: Set up S3 buckets with appropriate naming conventions.
Configure Bucket Policies: Define access permissions for buckets and objects.
Enable Versioning: Activate versioning to keep multiple versions of objects.
Set Lifecycle Policies: Create rules to manage object lifecycle and storage class transitions.
Upload and Manage Objects: Practice uploading, copying, and deleting objects in S3.
Implement Static Website Hosting: Configure an S3 bucket for static website hosting.
Monitor S3 with CloudWatch: Set up CloudWatch metrics and alarms for S3 usage.
learningPath.project: Manage S3 bucket creation and policy with Terraform.

learningPath.title: Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2)
subtasks: Launch EC2 Instances: Create EC2 instances using various Amazon Machine Images (AMIs).
Configure Security Groups: Set up security groups to control inbound and outbound traffic.
Create Key Pairs: Generate key pairs for secure SSH access to EC2 instances.
Elastic IP Addresses: Allocate and associate Elastic IP addresses with EC2 instances.
Create AMIs: Create Amazon Machine Images from running instances for backups or scaling.
Monitor EC2 Instances: Use CloudWatch to track performance metrics and set alarms.
Terminate Instances: Safely terminate EC2 instances and understand the implications.
learningPath.project: Provision EC2 instances with specific configurations using Terraform.

learningPath.title: Elastic Block Storage (EBS) and EFS
subtasks: Create EBS Volumes: Provision EBS volumes and attach them to EC2 instances.
Snapshot EBS Volumes: Create snapshots for backup and recovery purposes.
Resize EBS Volumes: Understand how to modify the size of EBS volumes without downtime.
Create and Configure EFS: Set up an Elastic File System (EFS) for shared storage across instances.
Mount EFS on EC2 Instances: Learn how to mount EFS to EC2 instances for access.
Implement EBS Encryption: Enable encryption for EBS volumes for enhanced security.
Monitor EBS and EFS Performance: Use CloudWatch to monitor performance metrics.
learningPath.project: Create EBS volumes and EFS file systems using Terraform.

learningPath.title: Networking Basics
subtasks: Create a VPC: Set up a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) with custom CIDR blocks.
Configure Subnets: Create public and private subnets within the VPC.
Set Up Route Tables: Define route tables to control traffic flow within the VPC.
Implement Internet Gateway: Attach an Internet Gateway to allow internet access to public subnets.
Create NAT Gateway: Set up a NAT Gateway for private subnet instances to access the internet.
Configure Security Groups and NACLs: Implement security groups and Network ACLs for traffic control.
Launch EC2 Instances in VPC: Deploy EC2 instances within the configured VPC and subnets.
learningPath.project: Create a VPC with subnets and routing using Terraform.

learningPath.title: Databases Overview
subtasks: Launch an RDS Instance: Create a relational database instance using Amazon RDS.
Configure Database Security: Set up security groups and parameter groups for RDS.
Backup and Restore RDS: Understand how to perform backups and restore RDS databases.
Monitor RDS Performance: Use CloudWatch to monitor RDS instance metrics.
Scale RDS Instances: Learn about scaling options for RDS instances (read replicas, vertical scaling).
Implement Multi-AZ Deployments: Set up Multi-AZ for high availability.
Connect to RDS from EC2: Practice connecting an EC2 instance to the RDS database.
learningPath.project: Provision an RDS database instance using Terraform.

learningPath.title: Monitoring and Logging
subtasks: Set Up CloudWatch Alarms: Create alarms for EC2, RDS, and S3 metrics.
Implement CloudTrail: Enable AWS CloudTrail for API call logging.
Create CloudWatch Dashboards: Visualize metrics using CloudWatch dashboards.
Log Management: Set up logging for EC2 instances and S3 buckets.
Use AWS Config: Implement AWS Config to monitor resource configurations.
Analyze Logs with CloudWatch Logs Insights: Query and analyze logs for troubleshooting.
Integrate with SNS for Notifications: Set up Simple Notification Service (SNS) for alarm notifications.
learningPath.project: Configure CloudWatch monitoring and logging using Terraform.

learningPath.title: High Availability and Scaling
subtasks: Create Auto Scaling Groups: Define policies for scaling EC2 instances based on demand.
Set Up Load Balancers: Implement Application Load Balancers (ALB) for distributing traffic.
Configure Health Checks: Set health check rules for instances behind load balancers.
Implement Elastic Load Balancing: Understand different types of load balancers (ALB, NLB).
Test Auto Scaling Policies: Simulate load to test the auto scaling configuration.
Design for Failover: Implement strategies for failover and redundancy.
Monitor Auto Scaling Events: Use CloudWatch to monitor scaling events and performance.
learningPath.project: Create an Auto Scaling group and load balancer using Terraform.

learningPath.title: Security Best Practices
subtasks: Conduct a Security Review: Review existing IAM roles, policies, and permissions.
Implement Least Privilege Access: Adjust IAM policies to follow least privilege principles.
Configure Security Groups: Regularly review and update security group rules.
Enable AWS Config Rules: Set up AWS Config rules to monitor compliance.
Implement Encryption: Enable encryption for S3, EBS, and RDS.
Set Up GuardDuty: Enable Amazon GuardDuty for threat detection.
Regular Audits and Reporting: Schedule regular audits and generate security reports.
learningPath.project: Apply security best practices with Terraform configurations.

learningPath.title: Exam Preparation
subtasks: Take Practice Exams: Use practice tests to gauge knowledge and readiness.
Review Key Concepts: Go through flashcards or summaries of key topics.
Engage in Hands-On Labs: Participate in hands-on labs to reinforce learning.
Join Study Groups: Collaborate with peers for discussion and clarification.
Review AWS Documentation: Familiarize yourself with the official AWS documentation.
Create a Study Schedule: Plan study sessions leading up to the exam date.
Relax and Prepare Mentally: Ensure to take breaks and manage stress before the exam.
learningPath.project: Compile notes and resources for exam preparation.
